metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1895 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The py-bcrypt module before 0.3 for Python does not properly handle concurrent memory access, which allows attackers to bypass authentication via multiple authentication requests, which trigger the password hash to be overwritten.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-bcrypt - 0.4-1
python3-bcrypt - 0.4-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> lucid and precise aren't vulnerable as v0.1 did not release the GIL.

criterions.comment: python-bcrypt package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4-1').
